newsitem.title: USA: Fila Holdings Q2 hurt by slow U.S. sales.
newsitem.headline: Fila Holdings Q2 hurt by slow U.S. sales.

text.p: Fila Holdings SpA said Thursday that its weak second quarter earnings reflected a sales slowdown in the U.S. market.
The company said it was suffering from sluggish demand for basketball shoes and the a continued weakness in brand appeal in the U.S. basketball market.

The company also said its backlog scheduled for delivery in the U.S. for July through December, 1997, fell 14 percent from the year-earlier period, with footwear falling 15 percent and apparel down 13 percent.
Fila said it had experienced disappointing levels of holiday orders for its Grant Hill IV collection of footwear which had also affected orders of apparel.
Fila reported ADS earnings today of $0.56, versus $0.98 in the year-earlier period.
